meanings.definition: Not producing or incapable of producing offspring; sterile.
meanings.sent1: The barren land could not support any life.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's barren fields yielded no crops this season.
meanings.sent3: The barren tree felt left out among the lush forest.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt barren of ideas, like a desert devoid of oases.
meanings.sent5: The barren wasteland stretched as far as the eye could see, devoid of any signs of life.

meanings.sent1: The barren desert was hot and dry with no plants in sight.
meanings.sent2: The barren hill had no trees or bushes growing on it.
meanings.sent3: The barren garden needed some greenery to liven it up.
meanings.sent4: Her balcony was barren, with only a single wilted flower in a pot.
meanings.sent5: The barren landscape was a stark reminder of nature's harshness, with no greenery to be seen.

meanings.sent1: The barren meeting did not result in any new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The barren project failed to meet its deadline.
meanings.sent3: His attempts at fishing were barren, with no catch all day.
meanings.sent4: The barren job search left him feeling discouraged and hopeless.
meanings.sent5: The barren effort put into the task showed in the lack of progress made.
